content.description: This route is a hard slab and contains not many good hands. Thought the hardest part may be the feet when moving from the first few holds to above the green house. You can use the crack right by the 3rd to the right paw finger. Also to top out use the horizontal crack.
content.location: Slab Dive is to the left of the middle crack on the slab face of WSB.Â

content.description: This route requires good body tension. A lot of this route also need opposition. The start is the obvious first drill hole on the slab face move up the left side of a silver dihedral using arete holds. This whole line follows a curve that the arete creates.
content.protection: Pad   (maybe 2 pads to protect a barn door)
content.location: This route is located on the slab face of WSB. It is to the right of drill hole direct, and to the left of the silver dihedral arete, that separates the south face of the boulder and the slab face.

content.description: Start with the same start as Slab Dive, but traverse right around the arete and all the way to the side that faces the lake. The lip of the boulder is off, but any holds below the lip are fair game. When you get to the face with red graffiti, the lip is on, but the rocks below it for your feet are off as it's pretty much the ground at that point. Match above the last "E" in the red graffiti "LEDGE". See pictures for clarifications and beta. Established by Peter Elholm.
content.protection: Several pads and a spotter, or one spotter and one person to move the pad along with the climber.
content.location: Starts on the holds of Slab Dive and goes all the way around the boulder to the side that faces the lake.

content.description: This route is a good warm up that only uses 4 holds. Start on the obvious lower drill hole, and continue from a silver ledges to the second drill hole, top out from there. This route requires balance and may be hard for kids due to the long reaches. Be careful to not crimp to hard on the drill holes because they can be sharp. Avoid using the crack in the middle of the face as well.
content.location: This route lies to the right of the crack going through the middle of the slab face. It is the middle route on the slab face. It also tops out in the middle of the slab face.

content.description: This boulder is about 10 ft tall and is large rock outcropping in the shape of a U. This boulder can be easily distinguished by a white sun painted on the boulders inside slab face. The main climbing is on the slab inside face containing the sun. The landing is very flat and can be a good picnic area likewise with the the top of the boulder. There are two descents, one is straight down the middle on of the U's arc and is the most obvious. The other descent is on the lake side of the boulder and is easier if you are walking with pads further north. This spot is also special because it has rock jumping possibilities, the top and a about 5 feet tall spot.
